heading: new registrars join the melee
subheading: with eight more successful applicants, icann expands its list of eligible domain name registrars to 43.
author: wired news report
text: the domain name business is getting more competitive as another eight companies are in the running to hand out .com, .net and .org domains. the internet corporation for assigned names and numbers (icann) said tuesday that the eight applicants met its accreditation criteria.they are abacus america, advanced systems consulting, casdns, inc., domain bank, inc., marvin enterprises, inc./global knowledge group, the name-it corporation/advanced internet technologies, netnation communications, inc., and psi-japan, inc.five companies currently share domain name registration with network solutions in a test period which ends 24 june.icann is transitioning domain name registration from the sole province of network solutions to a competitive system that now lists 43 companies.to move toward a more open market in the name registration business, the us department of commerce created icann, a nonprofit group established to take over administration of the internet. this was one of the first major steps taken by the organization, which is still in its infancy.network solutions had held an exclusive contract with the federal government since 1993.
